Text: LCs Cc Further to our conversation Friday nightwas that Friday anyway we have the following needs An LC to Henry petroleum for mil This app is at Enron and was originally sent to Chase for issuancenow Chase says no this one is getting touchy New apps being forwarded this morning that need issuing Ultramar Diamond Shamrock mil Astra Energy Canada mil Koch Canada Pending Choctaw II Oil and Gas millwe are waiting for the verdict on this onebut dont hold much hope for getting out of it Should know this morning ALSONEED TO HAVE COST NUMBERS ON THESE LCS SOME OF THE CUSTOMERS ARE OFFERRING TO PAY FOR THEM BUT WANT A NUMBER

Re Rogas Pipelines Cc the encroachment permit yesterday and have requested the insurance certificate accordingly There are alot of requirements in this item and may take us getting waivers or ammendments from the carrier I will keep you informed on the timing This will probably not be a quick turn around like a vanilla certificate Kenny Maltby To cc Bob JacobsLong ott Edward PM ott Matt NRON Molly ott Scott ott Susan ott Subject Re Rogas PipelinesDocument link Susan Ralph Thats great Larry I understand that we can not do anything in the bypass channel and this will be made clear in the environmental orientation Monday If we dont get compensation credits insurance certificates and written approval from the Fish and Game for trapping we can not proceed any father than the carrot field Once we get the approvals the plan is to clear right of way and string pipe week ahead The bypass channel is a month into the project LarryCampbell enroncom To Kenny ott Matt NRON Bob JacobsLong ott Edward ott Susan ott Molly ott AM Scott ott cc Subject Re Rogas Pipelines Kenny I have contacted the agencies for which permits and approvals were requested and have been given the green light to initiate the Rogas project Please understand that IN NO WAY can we initiate activities associated with the bypass channel construction until approval is given by each agency contacted I will apprise you as the approvals are received or if further information is requested by each agency Enjoy digging in the carrot field Forwarded by Larry CampbellETSEnron on AM on PM To MattHughes OTTCOM cc Subject Re Rogas Pipelines Kenny as you may know there were environmental applications submitted to various local state and regional agencies requesting approval to initiate this project and most of the requests apply to crossing the bypass channel As of today we have received one approval and that from the State Fire Marshall Office of Pipeline Safety granting us a waiver so that we can lay the pipe above ground as opposed to below ground I have calls into the other agencies for which applications and requests were submitted but have had no reply I would caution that we might get into trouble for initiating a construction project without consent and approval from a particular agency as agencies many times look at an entire project even though their jurisdiction may only apply in one specific area of a project This is particularily the case in air permitting where an applicant can not even construct a road or bring in construction materials until the air permit is issued Because this is my first project in California Id like to be sure of this and make follow up calls to all agencies for which applications and requests were submitted and verify that we can initiate the construction as long as we dont impact a specific or strategic portion ie the bypass channel for sometime down the road when we are well into the project Ill call you tomorrow and let you know on PM To MattHughes OTTCOM cc Subject Rogas Pipelines We are going to start the Rogas project Monday The first ft leaving Rogas is across a carrot field that has been harvested and is not in any habitat The farmer is due to start working the field the th so we need to get the pipe laid The contractor is going to start with a reduced crew and expects to be finished crossing the initial ft by the end of the week The following things must be accomplished early next week so we can continue construction Checks received so we can purchase compensation credits from Kern Water Bank and Area Be added to the KWBs Master Permit That will happen when they receive there check Insurance certificates in the hands of the Kern County Water Agency and West Kern Water If the contractor has to stop we may be faced with additional mobilization and demobilization charges
